page.title: 01GOULCEBY-ASTERBY-SCAMBLESBY
page.content: The area comprising this "D Block",is to be found approximately midway between the towns of{HORNCASTLE } and{LOUTH,}crossed by the main road, "A 153". The land is typical Lincolnshire wolds farming country,consisting of arable land,pasture and woodland plantations of varying age and type. Three main communities exist in the area:{Goulceby}and{Asterby}near the centre of the block,and{Scamblesby}at the South-Eastern corner.There is evidence of human habitation around the area from pre-Roman times,and the{ {"Blue stone heath"}road running East to West just North of the area,was a trackway from the Neolithic period. The area is traversed E.to W.by a walkers'route{The Viking Way.}This is well posted,across country & by road and allows a good view of the scenery.
